info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 14 at 2:12PM PST until December 16 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM WEDNESDAY TO 1 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph in exposed areas in Klamath County and up to 65 mph in high terrain areas of Lake County. * WHERE...Some areas east of the Cascades including Highway 97 from northern portions of Klamath Falls north to Crescent, Highway 140 at Bly Mountain and Quartz Mountain Summit and Warner Mountain Summit. * WHEN...From 7 AM Wednesday to 1 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The most significant, steady snowfall is expected generally from Modoc Point on Highway 97 northward. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
